00001 /*
00002     kmeans.cpp - Class source file for K means clustering.
00003     Beginning Date : June 16, 2006
00004     Completion Date : June 20, 2006
00005     Latest Modification : June 21, 2006
00006 
00007     Code written by Sumandeep Banerjee, DFKI, Kaiserslautern, Germany
00008     sumandeep.banerjee@gmail.com
00009 */
00010 
00011 // standard include files
00012 #include <stdio.h>
00013 #include <stdlib.h>
00014 #include <time.h>
00015 
00016 // project header files
00017 #include "kmeans.h"
00018 
00028 void Kmeans :: KmeansCalculate (double **X, double **mean, bool **responsibility, long n, long d, long k) {
00029     long winnerID, R, iterations;
00030     double distance, minDistance, *newMean, *oldMean, error;
00031 
00032     // assume default vaule of K (number of clusters) as sqrt(N) if not supplied by user
00033     N = n;
00034     D = d;
00035     K = k;
00036     if (K == 0)
00037         K = (long) sqrt ((double)N);
00038 
00039     // random initialization of the K means from the data set
00040     srand (time (NULL));
00041     for (k = 0; k < K; k++)
00042     {
00043         n = (long)(((double) rand () / (double) RAND_MAX) * (double)N);
00044         for (d = 0; d < D; d++)
00045             mean [k][d] = X [n][d];
00046     }
00047 
00048     iterations = 0;
00049     while (1)
00050     {
00051         // assignment step, select winners for each data point
00052         for (n = 0; n < N; n ++)
00053         {
00054             // minDistance = 0.0;
00055             for (k = 0; k < K; k ++)
00056             {
00057                 distance = 0.0;
00058                 for (d = 0; d < D; d ++)
00059                 {
00060                     distance += (X [n][d] - mean [k][d]) * (X [n][d] - mean [k][d]);
00061                 }
00062                 // Euclidean distance between nth data point and kth mean
00063                 distance = sqrt (distance);
00064                 if (k == 0 || distance < minDistance)
00065                 {
00066                     minDistance = distance;
00067                     // index of the winner mean
00068                     winnerID = k;
00069                 }
00070                 responsibility [n][k] = false;
00071             }
00072             // responsibility matrix
00073             responsibility [n][winnerID] = true;
00074         }
00075 
00076         // update step, update kth mean to the mean of its responsibilities
00077         newMean = (double *) calloc (D, sizeof (double));
00078         oldMean = (double *) calloc (D, sizeof (double));
00079         error = 0.0;
00080         for (k = 0; k < K; k ++)
00081         {
00082             R = 0;
00083             for (d = 0; d < D; d ++)
00084             {
00085                 newMean [d] = 0.0;
00086                 oldMean [d] = mean [k][d];
00087             }
00088 
00089             for (n = 0; n < N; n ++)
00090             {
00091                 if (responsibility [n][k] == true)
00092                 {
00093                     for (d = 0; d < D; d ++)
00094                     {
00095                         // compute new mean of the kth cluster
00096                         newMean [d] +=  X [n][d];
00097                     }
00098                     R ++;
00099                 }
00100             }
00101 
00102             if (R > 0)
00103             {
00104                 for (d = 0; d < D; d ++)
00105                 {
00106                     // update mean with the new mean
00107                     mean [k][d] = newMean [d] / (double)R;
00108                 }
00109             }
00110 
00111             // compute sum of changes in all the means
00112             for (d = 0; d < D; d ++)
00113             {
00114                 error += (mean [k][d] - oldMean [d]) * (mean [k][d] - oldMean [d]);
00115             }
00116             error = sqrt (error); // L2Norm is used for error measure
00117         }
00118 
00119         iterations ++;
00120         // break loop when error i.e. sum of changes in means goes below required precision
00121         // maximum iterations 100
00122         if (iterations >= 100 || error < _PRECISION)
00123             break;
00124     }
00125 } // end of KmeansCalculate
